sub_title: MMgt(Mktg/Fin), BA(PR), F FIN | Banking & Finance | Sustainable Business: Strategy & Innovation
summary:
I am an impact-driven professional with 15 years’ experience in business management, the property industry and financial services sector. My professional and educational experiences span Australia and Europe, meanwhile with volunteer involvement in the lesser developed nation of Solomon Islands. During recent years, I was the decision-maker for unique high net worth individuals and business clientele throughout the economic cycles triggered by COVID-19. This included crisis management and growth prospects for specialised client portfolios at Australia’s largest Business Bank and best Private Bank.

I value the power of relationship building, information sharing, and have experienced how this has prompted the delivery of successful collaborations and client outcomes contributing to economic growth and sustainability.

I am eager to explore diverse opportunities where I can apply my extensive talents in a dynamic environment that aligns to my interests in banking and finance, strategy and innovation, and sustainability. I expect that this opportunity will nourish my continued intellectual curiosity, solution-based problem-solving skills harnessed from both critical thinking and lateral thinking approaches, and frequented visionary thinking for which I have an aptitude to translate into outcomes.

awards.title: Peak Award
awards.description:
Successfully nominated as the recipient of the Peak Award at NAB Private Wealth, Australia:
People leader nomination for coaching and mentorship during the nationwide project Fix-It-Fast challenge that was participated by the Private Banking Associate team. There were 80 change ideas submitted nationwide to Group Executive level with Private Banking submitting 5 ideas and winning the challenge overall with an idea/solution to change a business process relating to customer fraud. The outcome expected from adopting the process change will deliver higher client satisfaction due to improved timing of troubleshooting client’s enquiries (via phone, email, in-person) regarding fraudulent activity and data management.

projects.title: QLD State Advisory Committee (Australian Marketing Institute)
projects.description:
The QLD State Advisory Committee consists of 12 members based in various metropolitan and regional areas, who play a vital role in being the local face of the Australian Marketing Institute (AMI) by supporting members on the ground in their local areas.

Committee members play a vital role in attracting and retaining members and designing, building and implementing events at the local level.

AMI is a member focused organisation. Member needs can be varied and change quite dramatically. Therefore, it is important that the State Advisory Committee has an active and dynamic member listening capability to ensure relevant events are staged with local members.

In 2015, we will work with the CEO/Management to promote and deliver relevant events that resonate with our members. Our member events will have three (3) components - information about the AMI, professional development and member networking.

projects.title: Connecting Women QLD (National Australia Bank)
projects.description: Connecting Women QLD, an employee-led network, consists of 10 committee members based in various metropolitan and regional areas. Our aim is to create an inclusive workplace engaging men and women across our organisation to enable female leadership success. Attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse workforce is imperative to NAB’s People strategy. Our member events will have three (3) components – information about NAB, professional development and enterprise networking.

profile_positions.description:
Servicing the needs of unique high net worth private clients with a focus on the commercial property sector (including construction, development, and investment) whose complex financial situations require a specialist approach and commitment to customer satisfaction via tailored delivery of holistic banking, investment solutions and portfolio management services. In some instances, this involved working jointly with colleagues of Corporate & Institutional Banking and Commercial Real Estate.
- Portfolio exposure: $220M
- Client groups: 13
- New and in-progress opportunities: c.$150M
- Delegated authority: $30M (100%)
profile_positions.title: Private Client Director

profile_positions.description:
Servicing the needs of (trading) business owners (medium to large enterprise) with a focus on the commercial property sector (including construction, development, and investment) whose complex financial situations require a specialist approach and commitment to customer satisfaction via tailored delivery of holistic banking, investment solutions and portfolio management services.
- Portfolio exposure: $180M
- Client groups: 20
- New and in-progress opportunities: c.$65M
- Delegated authority: $30M (100%)
profile_positions.title: Senior Business Banking Manager

profile_positions.description: Designing and delivering onboarding programmes for new teams of business bankers (c.25 FTE) specialising in high-value client retention within a call-centre environment (for both inbound and proactive outbound calling). This involved continuing tailored coaching programmes via ad-hoc, 1:1, 1:2, 2:2 and team methods; working jointly with team managers, the wider Direct Retention Leadership group, and segment stakeholders acknowledging customer satisfaction at the forefront. Further, change management, data strategy, and Agile methods were exercised fundamentals to this role. This business idea was transformed from a pilot initiative whereby my commitment to talent capability contributed significantly for phase progression to formal implementation stage and was a foundation for further team expansions/FTE allocations.
profile_positions.title: Credit & Capability Coach, Business & Private Retention

profile_positions.description:

volunteer_experiences.description: I learned how to repair faulty electrical goods including re-wiring a hair curling wand, replacing a faulty pump inside of a coffee machine, replacing a blown fuse in a microwave and repairing the functionality of a toaster. This included locating the fault, understanding the internal mechanism of the equipment and the individual parts, so that the repair could be understood and achieved. NochMall is the first secondhand department store in Berlin.
